messages.content: You are an expert in performance prediction for nitride materials.

W2N crystallizes in the trigonal P-3m1 space group. The structure is two-dimensional and consists of three W2N sheets oriented in the (0, 0, 1) direction. There are two inequivalent W sites. In the first W site, W(1) is bonded in a 3-coordinate geometry to three equivalent N(2) atoms. All W(1)-N(2) bond lengths are 2.10 Å. In the second W site, W(2) is bonded in a single-bond geometry to one N(2) atom. The W(2)-N(2) bond length is 1.97 Å. N(2) is bonded in a rectangular see-saw-like geometry to one W(2) and three equivalent W(1) atoms. What is the Band Gap and Predicted Formation Energy of this nitride material?
Band Gap : 0.0 eV; Predicted Formation Energy : 0.44413373652777904 eV/atom.
You are an expert in performance prediction for nitride materials.

W2N3 is Molybdenite-like structured and crystallizes in the hexagonal P6_3/mmc space group. The structure is two-dimensional and consists of two W2N3 sheets oriented in the (0, 0, 1) direction. W(1) is bonded in a 6-coordinate geometry to three equivalent N(1) and three equivalent N(2) atoms. All W(1)-N(1) bond lengths are 2.02 Å. All W(1)-N(2) bond lengths are 2.24 Å. There are two inequivalent N sites. In the first N site, N(2) is bonded to six equivalent W(1) atoms to form distorted edge-sharing NW6 pentagonal pyramids. In the second N site, N(1) is bonded in a distorted T-shaped geometry to three equivalent W(1) atoms. What is the Band Gap and Predicted Formation Energy of this nitride material?
Band Gap : 0.0 eV; Predicted Formation Energy : -0.217129423250003 eV/atom.
You are an expert in performance prediction for nitride materials.

W2N3 crystallizes in the monoclinic Cm space group. There are three inequivalent W sites. In the first W site, W(1) is bonded to one N(1), one N(4), two equivalent N(2), and two equivalent N(3) atoms to form a mixture of distorted corner and edge-sharing WN6 pentagonal pyramids. The corner-sharing octahedral tilt angles range from 4-45°. The W(1)-N(1) bond length is 2.11 Å. The W(1)-N(4) bond length is 2.10 Å. There is one shorter (2.11 Å) and one longer (2.13 Å) W(1)-N(2) bond length. There is one shorter (2.09 Å) and one longer (2.11 Å) W(1)-N(3) bond length. In the second W site, W(2) is bonded to one N(1), one N(4), two equivalent N(2), and two equivalent N(3) atoms to form a mixture of distorted corner, edge, and face-sharing WN6 pentagonal pyramids. The corner-sharing octahedral tilt angles are 1°. The W(2)-N(1) bond length is 2.07 Å. The W(2)-N(4) bond length is 2.09 Å. Both W(2)-N(2) bond lengths are 2.08 Å. Both W(2)-N(3) bond lengths are 2.09 Å. In the third W site, W(3) is bonded to one N(1), one N(4), two equivalent N(2), and two equivalent N(3) atoms to form a mixture of corner, edge, and face-sharing WN6 octahedra. The W(3)-N(1) bond length is 1.98 Å. The W(3)-N(4) bond length is 2.11 Å. Both W(3)-N(2) bond lengths are 2.01 Å. Both W(3)-N(3) bond lengths are 2.10 Å. There are four inequivalent N sites. In the first N site, N(1) is bonded in a rectangular see-saw-like geometry to one W(2), one W(3), and two equivalent W(1) atoms. In the second N site, N(2) is bonded in a rectangular see-saw-like geometry to one W(2), one W(3), and two equivalent W(1) atoms. In the third N site, N(3) is bonded in a rectangular see-saw-like geometry to one W(2), one W(3), and two equivalent W(1) atoms. In the fourth N site, N(4) is bonded in a rectangular see-saw-like geometry to one W(2), one W(3), and two equivalent W(1) atoms. What is the Band Gap and Predicted Formation Energy of this nitride material?
Band Gap : 0.0 eV; Predicted Formation Energy : -0.557304915249999 eV/atom.
You are an expert in performance prediction for nitride materials.

W3N4 crystallizes in the cubic Pm-3m space group. W(1) is bonded to two equivalent N(1) and four equivalent N(2) atoms to form a mixture of corner and edge-sharing WN6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedra are not tilted. Both W(1)-N(1) bond lengths are 2.11 Å. All W(1)-N(2) bond lengths are 2.11 Å. There are two inequivalent N sites. In the first N site, N(1) is bonded to six equivalent W(1) atoms to form corner-sharing NW6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedra are not tilted. In the second N site, N(2) is bonded in a square co-planar geometry to four equivalent W(1) atoms. What is the Band Gap and Predicted Formation Energy of this nitride material?
Band Gap : 0.0 eV; Predicted Formation Energy : -0.165709184523807 eV/atom.
You are an expert in performance prediction for nitride materials.
